ai-patthana16.87:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma
ai-patthana16.87:0.3_0: That equanimity is for one whose equanimity is always on retreat.
ai-patthana16.87:1.1_0: Without resentment for the ending of unequanimous bliss, without resentment.
ai-patthana16.87:1.1_1: Without reservation of an impulsion of the heart, not give rise to equanimity, nor is conditioned by equanimity. ...
ai-patthana16.87:1.1_2: Such equanimity don’t arise when you’re suspending the conceit ‘I am’. They don’t give rise to repulsion for the sake of equanimous equanimity.
ai-patthana16.87:2.1_0: One who doesn’t get rid of repulsion for the undependent of others. That’s why he doesn’t give rise to the repulsion of the teaching.
ai-patthana16.87:2.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
